intro: Melampyrum lineare subsp. pectinatum, commonly known as the narrowleaf snakeweed, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, commonly known as the broomrape family, and is characterized by its parasitic nature, relying on host plants for nutrients. The plant typically has slender, erect stems with opposite, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and clustered in racemes, usually displaying a yellowish or orange color. It thrives in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and woodland edges.
